text:
Tough time to be a Chipotle lover. Not only did the fast-casual burrito kingpin raise prices in several states last quarter, but then the chain went and got all up close and personal with the customers of its Virginia Beach store, closing it indefinitely after employees reportedly refused to comply with coronavirus safety protocols.
If you needed any more bad news in your life at present, it also appears Chipotle might begin hiking prices further in the months ahead, too. All told, shares of Chipotle Mexican Grill (ticker: CMG) dropped 4.8% on the day following these twin bits of bum data. Tough time to be a bull on this particular ticker symbol.
For perspective – there is actually reason for bulls to still like CHIPOTLE STOCK despite today. So here’s my thought process on why chip stock bears may want to pump the brakes.

**1. Shortage Of Beef Options. I see how we all love cheap, highquality burgers or tacos. If suppliers increase their cost structures in light of supply side pressures, that would limit options. Even if consumers do adapt to greater price increases in Q’s and Yums etc., they don’t have a plethora options to fall back to like the situation previously decades ago when we had many different quick-food and burger chains giving similar offerings at distinct pricepoints.
